Originally developing a series of demos in the early 1980Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s, Dutch Traditional Metal band EAR DANGER didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t release their debut album Ã¢â‚¬Å“Full Blast at LastÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ until 2011. The current lineup includes two original members in bassist Matt Verschoor and drummer Dick Vijgen along with two younger musicians in vocalist/ guitarist Leon Lohmann and guitarist Ivo Metz. Spurred on by the gigs and success of this full length, the quartet decided to write another set of songs and release a follow up Ã¢â‚¬â€œ so letÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s see if Ã¢â‚¬Å“Warrior SoulÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ can hold up to the standard the band has pushed forth.

Stylistically EAR DANGER prefer playing close to the NWOBHM vest Ã¢â‚¬â€œ soaring vocals, easy on the ear/ shout a long choruses, guitars and bass leading the music charge while the drumming has this youthful energy to raise fists and chants. The title track opens the proceedings, a glorious rally cry for the cause, the lead break in line with speedier RAVEN Ã¢â‚¬â€œ while the follow up Ã¢â‚¬Å“Star IllusionÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ has a boat load of JUDAS PRIEST elements in the opening two riffs that nick Ã¢â‚¬Å“Rapid FireÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ from the Ã¢â‚¬Å“British SteelÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ album.

Leon may not be the most pitch perfect singer, but a lot of times in this genre attitude can more than make up for deficiencies Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and I believe his sharp metal intuition matches up well to the semi-gallops, classic 80Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s hooks, and general rocking material at hand. Check out Ã¢â‚¬Å“I Am Your EnemyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“CrusaderÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ for his charm, something that I could have easily pictured coming from 1981-1983. And the cover art is as Ã¢â‚¬ËœTraditional MetalÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ as you can get- a clear indication that their lifelong commitment will not waver.

I can picture this band galvanizing the younger metal bands to keep the purity of the genre at heart when they create new material. Ã¢â‚¬Å“Warrior SoulÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is another fantastic record, and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m so glad that EAR DANGER kept the faith Ã¢â‚¬â€œ as the long journey is paying off. 4 Star Rating
